1.plan:
Plan:
1. Introduction: Introduce the topic of handstands and state the main idea that it is not difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.
2. Body Paragraph 1: Explain the first step of doing a handstand, which is to stand on your hands. Describe the proper hand placement and body position.
3. Body Paragraph 2: Discuss the second step of doing a handstand, which is to kick up your legs. Explain how to use momentum and balance to lift your legs into the air.
4. Conclusion: Summarize the main points of the passage and restate the main idea that it isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.
1.sentence: It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

test_output:
Passage:
Handstands, often perceived as a daunting feat, are surprisingly achievable if you simply stand on your hands. The first step involves placing your hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread wide, and aligning your body in a straight line from head to heels. It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

Next, generate momentum by swinging your legs forward and backward. As you gain momentum, kick your legs up simultaneously, using your core and arm strength to lift your body into the air. It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

Maintaining balance is crucial. Keep your gaze fixed on a spot in front of you and engage your core muscles to stabilize your body. If you feel yourself losing balance, gently lower your legs and try again. It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

In conclusion, mastering a handstand is not as challenging as it may seem. By simply standing on your hands, kicking up your legs, and maintaining balance, you can achieve this seemingly complex feat. Remember, it isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

Place your hands shoulder-width apart, fingers spread wide, and align your wrists directly under your shoulders. Keep your body straight and your core engaged. It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.

Once both legs are extended, hold the position for as long as possible. It isn't difficult to do a handstand if you just stand on your hands.
